definitions.definition: ( Ancient Rome , historical ) A legally defined unit of Roman society , being a collection of people related through a common ancestor by birth , marriage or adoption , possibly over many generations , and sharing the same nomen gentilicium .
( anthropology ) A tribal subgroup whose members are characterized by having the same descent , usually along the male line ; clan.
( zoology ) A host-specific lineage of a brood parasite species.

main_definition: ( Ancient Rome , historical ) A legally defined unit of Roman society , being a collection of people related through a common ancestor by birth , marriage or adoption , possibly over many generations , and sharing the same nomen gentilicium .

definitions.definition: plural of gen ( clipping of generation ).
